title: Econometrics II
overview: This course provides a solid theoretical and practical foundation for explaining empirical evidence: short-term and long-term economic relationships, simultaneous effects of variables, effects of factors on choices, fixed and random effects, components of time series and the nature of a time series. The course consists of two parts: econometric theory and practical experimentation with each type of model using the R software.

key_concepts: Discrete choice models like logit, probit, multinomial
Basic concepts and models of time series and economic forecasting

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Modeling to determine short-term and long-term impacts
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will be able to model to determine short-term and long-term impacts, simultaneous effects of variables, effects of factors on choices, fixed and random effects, and components of time series.
Students will be able to analyze and evaluate models, and provide opinions based on scientific calculations.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Using specialized software for estimation, analysis, and optimization of models
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will be able to use specialized software for estimation, analysis, and optimization of models.

skill_outcomes.skill_name: Working in groups, self-study, and proposing research topics on economics/finance/business management
skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will be able to work in groups, self-study, and propose research topics on economics/finance/business management, and critically evaluate related content and policies.
